response.original_title: One Night In June: The Black Hills Flood of 1972
response.overview: On June 9th 1972 the Canyon Lake Damn became clogged with debris. With heavy rain fall sweeping the hills the damn couldnâ€™t hold the weight and it burst leading to over 200 deaths, 3,000 injuries, 1,000 homes destroyed, and 5,000 automobiles totaled. One Night in June is a documentary played in Rapid City's Journey museum which tell the tragic tale of the area's deadliest flood.
response.tagline: Darkness fell across the Black Hills that one night in June.
response.title: One Night In June: The Black Hills Flood of 1972
